metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1206 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A hash collision flaw was found in the IPv6 connection lookup table in the Linux kernelâ€™s IPv6 functionality when a user makes a new kind of SYN flood attack. A user located in the local network or with a high bandwidth connection can increase the CPU usage of the server that accepts IPV6 connections up to 95%. It was discovered that the IPv6 implementation in the Linux kernel contained a high rate of hash collisions in connection lookup table. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (excessive CPU consumption).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic-64k - 6.2.0-34.34
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-aws - 6.2.0-1013.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-azure - 6.2.0-1014.14
